pageContext.name: Named Tuples
pageContext.title: Named Tuples
pageContext.html:
Tuples are arrays where the order is important to the type system, you can learn more about them in example:tuples In TypeScript 4.0, the type of a Tuple's gained the ability to give a name to the different parts of the array. For example, you used to write a Lat Long location via a tuple: 
type OldLocation = [number, number]

const locations: OldLocation[] = [
    [40.7144, -74.006],
    [53.6458, -1.785]
]
// Knowing which is Latitude and Longitude is ambiguous, and so you would more likely have called it a LatLong tuple. With 4.0, you can write: 
type NewLocation = [lat: number, long: number]

const newLocations: NewLocation[] = [
    [52.3702, 4.8952],
    [53.3498, -6.2603]
]
// The names now show up in the editor when you hover over the 0 and 1 at the end of the next line 
const firstLat = newLocations[0][0]
const firstLong = newLocations[0][1]
// While that might seem a tad underwhelming, the main goal is to ensure that information isn't lost when working with the type system. For example, when extracting parameters from a function using the Parameter utility type: 
function centerMap(lng: number, lat: number) { }

// In 4.0, this keeps lng and lat
type CenterMapParams = Parameters

// In 3.9, this would look like
type OldCenterMapParams = [number, number]
// Making some of the more complex type manipulation lossy for the parameter information.
